review: Chromecast is the device that you didn't know you needed till you started using it. Setup is dead simple. Then you simply hit the cast button on your phone or laptop, and the home theatre comes to life, playing Netflix,  Pandora, or "couch-sourced" YouTube playlists from all friends in attendance. Your phone becomes the all-in-one remote that even your grandma can figure out, and it works from everywhere your WiFi reaches. And there are services you can use to stream your own content as well! Once you start using one, you'll want one for every tv in the house.
author: Ian "ian@razordaze.com"

review: I wanted to be able to "mirror" my Chrome browser onto the TV in order to watch iSho.ws, but the Chromecast would not allow me to do this. I have and iPhone, an iPad, and a Dell Laptop (all running Chrome as primary browser). I was misled to think that the Chromecast would "mirror" my Chrome browser directly onto the TV, but it does not do this. It can run YouTube, Hulu Plus (which I don't use), and Netflix (which I don't use, because iSho.ws is free).
